definition: historical name of Shenyang 瀋陽|沈阳 in modern Liaoning province
to hold/to contain/to ladle/to pick up with a utensil
surname Sheng
flourishing/vigorous/magnificent/extensively
abbr. for Beijing/surname Jing/Jing ethnic minority
capital city of a country/big/algebraic term for a large number (old)/artificial mound (old)

sentences.english: At Qing Dynasty, it was a part of Shengjing Imperial Summer Resort.
sentences.chinese: 这样一座城寨清朝时为盛京围场一部分。

sentences.english: The official name was changed to Shengjing in Chinese, or Mukden ; in Manchu 1634.
sentences.chinese: 官方更名为盛京中文，或沉阳，在1634年满。

sentences.english: The city was also known as Shengjing or Fengtian.
sentences.chinese: 这座城市也被称为盛京或奉天。
